column1: Compiling PolyMage Domain-Specific Language for Emerging Parallel Architectures#Uday Kumar Reddy Bondhugula (IISc
column4: Hyderabad)#Department of Science and Technology - Rs. 80 lacs only#2017 - 2020#This proposal seeks to conduct further research and development on PolyMage
column5: a new domain-specific language and its compiler
column6: initiated by the Multicore Computing Lab
column7: at the Indian Institute of Science. PolyMage was developed as a DSL for the domain of image processing pipelines. The proposed work is focused on developing support for PolyMage to target emerging parallel architectures
column8: including customized reconfigurable architectures like FPGAs. On such architectures
column9: besides customizing a hardware design to the application at hand through a dataflow-style architecture (as opposed to instruction-based)
column10: it is also possible to customize the precision of operations at hand to desired levels. This leads to high-performing
column12: and power-efficient design capable of delivering acceleration and high energy efficiency when compared to conventional general-purpose multicore processors or even GPUs. In addition
column13: we also plan to extend the scope of computation patterns to target through PolyMage.

column1: Large Scale Distributed Model Checking#Suresh Purini
column4: India - Rs. 40 lacs#2014 - 2016#The objective of the proposed research work is to consider the implementation of model checking on distributed cloud-based platforms in order to make model checking efficient and scalable. This will
column6: widen the scope of industry-based problems to which model checking can be applied.

column1: State variable approach to the model-driven development of software for reactive systems#Venkatesh Choppella#Siemens India
column3: India - Rs. 14 lacs#2011 - 2013#The objective of the proposed research work is towards the development of software in reactive systems via model-driven development using state variable approach.
